about_the_game:
Space shooters never die.
1993 is a testament to that, honoring classics like Life Force, R-Type and Xenon II. We're keeping the genre alive.

⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀

1993 S.M was made in 1993. It is not made to look retro. It is not polished for today's tech - this is the genuine thing!
It's 1993 - Today! (Further updated in 2020!)

What reviewers say:
  • Holy moly! I'm in! I'm sold! This is a freaking phenomenal game. 8-Bit Eric
    *I am so dead chuffed with this game. Jamie from the Games Shed
    *1993 Shenandoah has that same level of addictive quality in design and execution. Elliot Ossange - Bonusstage
    *I absolutely love this game! It is soo charming! Jamie from the Games Shed
    *The enemy is varied and vast, coming in many flavours and types. There are basically everything and anything you can think of. Elliot Ossange - Bonusstage
    *This is an absolute gem! I really really recommend this! Jamie from the Games Shed
    *I can’t recommend 1993 Shenandoah enough. The aesthetics of the design, the levels... Elliot Ossange - Bonusstage
    *I'm definitely digging the hell out of this game. 8-Bit Eric


  • You're in charge! Explore and secure the different worlds in the order that fits your taste and urge.
  • The kick ass weapon system lets you unlock weapons for use in later play sessions. We feature both classic powerful weapons plus some fresh smart weapons.
  • Of almost 100 deadly enemy types, we have crafted unique evil behaviours for most of them.
  • As an extra game mechanic we have introduced a new health and shield system for more interesting game play.
  • Up to four player co-op mode.

In short:
  • 9 Ships to choose from
  • 25 Different weapons with 3 power levels
  • 14 Levels
  • 10 Different Bosses

⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀

Started in the age of the Amiga 500, this game was featured in Amiga format and Commodore User - two of the largest gaming magazines of the time. A series of unfortunate events prevented this space shooter to get finished. We plan to do that now!

⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀

Game story:
"Towards the end of the interstellar wars, chaos spread and one band of elite mercenaries acted more like pirates and looters than actual soldiers. The leader of this group was the notorious and infamous Colonel Nestor.

Without a doubt the biggest prize of their looting campaigns was the Spacemachine: a device designed to terraform barren planets and making them habitable. With this device, and the rest of their treasure, Nestor and his men started to build an army that now poses a great threat to the known star systems.

Mission: Bring back the Space Machine."

Featured on:
detailed_description:
Join our Discord!


Just Updated

New update out now!



  • New Level - Play the previously hidden level “Test Lab”.
  • Rookie mode
  • Improved Balancing/Player Experience
  • Improved Level Structure
  • Improved Boss difficulty and Attack Patterns
  • Updated Weapons
  • More Weapon Options in CO-OP Mode
  • Razer Chroma Lighting Effects

mac_requirements.minimum:
Minimum:
  • OS: Mountain Lion
  • Processor: Inte Core 2 Duo
  • Memory: 3 GB RAM
  • Graphics: ATI Radeon HD 2400 XT 128 MB
  • Storage: 200 MB available space
mac_requirements.recommended:
Recommended:
  • OS: Mountain Lion
  • Processor: Inte Core 2 Duo
  • Memory: 6 GB RAM
  • Graphics: ATI Radeon HD 2400 XT 128 MB
  • Storage: 200 MB available space

name: 1993 Space Machine

pc_requirements.minimum:
Minimum:
  • OS: Windows 10
  • Processor: Pentium Dual core 2GHz
  • Memory: 4 GB RAM
  • Graphics: DirectX 9 capable graphics card.
  • DirectX: Version 9.0
  • Storage: 200 MB available space
  • Sound Card: Sound Blaster Live
  • Additional Notes: Keyboard and cardboard box to sit on
pc_requirements.recommended:
Recommended:
  • OS: Windows 10
  • Processor: Pentium Dual core 2GHz
  • Memory: 8 GB RAM
  • Graphics: DirectX 9 capable graphics card.
  • DirectX: Version 9.0
  • Storage: 200 MB available space
  • Sound Card: Sound Blaster Live
  • Additional Notes: Gamepad and a comfy couch!

reviews:
“Yes, this looks like it came straight out of an Amiga computer in 1993”
80% – Game Vortex

“I can’t recommend 1993 Shenandoah enough”
9/10 – Bonus Stage

“1993 S.M is serving excellent, fun game play and great presentation”
4.5/5 – Studio Mudprints
short_description: Space shooters never die. 1993 is a testament to that. 1993 is a classic shoot em up celebrating games like Gradius, R-Type and Life Force.
